definition: A decentralized digital ledger that records transactions across many computers in a way that the registered transactions cannot be altered retroactively.
A digital or virtual currency that uses cryptography for security and operates independently of a central bank.
A digital tool (software or hardware) that allows users to store and manage their cryptocurrencies.
A secret number that allows cryptocurrency to be spent. It should be kept secure and never shared.
A cryptographic code that allows users to receive cryptocurrencies into their accounts.
A platform where users can buy, sell, or trade cryptocurrencies.
Short for Decentralized Finance, it refers to financial services using smart contracts on blockchains, without traditional intermediaries.
Non-Fungible Token, a unique digital asset that represents ownership of a specific item or piece of content, often on the blockchain.
A self-executing contract with the terms of the agreement directly written into code, running on a blockchain.
The process of validating transactions and adding them to the blockchain, often rewarded with new cryptocurrency coins.
A computer that helps run and validate a blockchain.
No single authority controls the network; it's distributed among users.
How blockchain participants agree on what’s true (e.g., Proof of Work).
A unique code that represents data. Used to verify blocks.
A coin runs on its own blockchain (e.g., BTC). A token runs on another chain (e.g., USDT on Ethereum).
A token that’s pegged to a fiat currency (e.g., USDT = $1).
Any crypto that's not Bitcoin.
(slang) A coin with little to no value or purpose, often used as a joke.
The fee you pay to execute a transaction on Ethereum.
A common standard for Ethereum tokens.
Ethereum Virtual Machine – runs smart contracts on Ethereum.
'Hold On for Dear Life' – slang for holding rather than selling.
Fear of Missing Out – buying impulsively due to hype.
Do Your Own Research – advice to learn before investing.
Inflating a coin’s price then selling off quickly.
Someone who owns a large amount of a cryptocurrency.
A smart contract holding tokens used for trading (DEX).
Locking up your tokens to help run the network and earn rewards.
Moving crypto between DeFi protocols to earn interest.
Total Value Locked – how much money is in a DeFi protocol.
Annual interest rates (APR = flat; APY = compounded).
12-24 words used to recover your crypto wallet.
Offline storage (e.g., Ledger, paper wallet).
Wallet connected to the internet (e.g., MetaMask).
A scam where devs disappear with investors’ funds.
'Good Morning' / 'Good Night' – common greetings in crypto chats.
'We’re All Gonna Make It' – optimistic crypto rallying cry.
'Not Gonna Make It' – usually joking about bad decisions.
Someone who refuses to sell, no matter what.
Someone who sells too quickly, afraid of losses.
